BiblioData.Title: Method, system, holder and assembly for transferring templates during imprint lithography processes
BiblioData.Abstract: Disclosed are a method system holder (40a) and template for transferring template (26). A motion stage having a template transfer holder is provided. The transfer holder is adapted to have a patterned mold facing the motion stage.

Claims.P: 1. A template transfer assembly (340; 440; 540; 640) comprising:
a template transfer substrate (344; 444; 544; 644);

a template (326; 426; 526; 626) having first and second sides, with said first side facing away from said template transfer substrate (344; 444; 544; 644) and said second side facing said template transfer substrate and having mold pattern (328; 428; 528; 628) formed thereon; and

polymerized imprint material (334; 434; 534; 634) disposed between said second side and said template transfer substrate (344; 444; 544; 644) to fixedly attach said template to said template transfer substrate.
2. The template transfer assembly as recited in claim 1 wherein said polymerized imprint material (334; 434; 534; 634) surrounds a sub-section of said mold or surrounds said entire mold.
3. The template transfer assembly as recited in claim 1 or in claim 2 wherein said polymerized imprint material (434; 534; 634) hermetically seals a sub-portion of said mold.

4. The template transfer assembly as recited in claim 1 or in claim 2 wherein said polymerized imprint material (334; 434; 534; 634) encapsulates said entire mold hermetically sealing said mold from an ambient.

5. The template transfer assembly as recited in any one of claims 1 to 4 wherein said template further includes a perimeter groove (537; 638) surrounding said mold with said polymerized imprint material (534; 634) disposed between said template transfer substrate and a region of said second side that is in superimposition with said perimeter groove.

6. The template transfer assembly as recited in any one of the preceding claims wherein said template transfer substrate (344; 444; 544; 644) comprises a semiconductor wafer, optionally wherein said semiconductor wafer has an additional template coupled thereto.

7. The template transfer assembly as recited in any one of the preceding claims wherein mold pattern (628) has grooves (628a) and protrusions (628b), the grooves (628a) including a nadir surface (628c) and the protrusions (628b) including an apex surface (628d).
8. The template transfer assembly as recited in claim 7, wherein:
one or more of nadir surfaces (628c) are spaced apart from major surface (626a) a first distance,
one or more apex surfaces (628d) are spaced-apart from major surface (626a) a second distance,
a surface (638) circumscribes either all or a subset of the grooves (628a) and the protrusions (628b), said surface (638) being spaced apart from major surface (626a) a third distance.

9. The template transfer assembly as recited in claim 8, wherein a mesa (636) is defined by third distance differing from both first and second distances; preferably wherein the third distance is less than either of first and second distances.

10. The template transfer assembly as recited in claim 9, wherein imprinting material (634) is disposed in regions between surface (638) and surface (631) of template transfer substrate (644) to maintain a fixed position between template (626) and template transfer substrate (644) without imprint material (634) contacting mold pattern (628) on template (626).
11. An imprint lithography system comprising:
an imprint head (18);
a template transfer assembly (340; 440; 540; 640) according to any one of the preceding claims.
12. A method of transferring an imprint lithography template, said method comprising:
providing a template transfer substrate (344; 444; 544; 644);
forming a selected volume of imprinting fluid onto said template transfer substrate (344; 444; 544; 644);
placing said template (326; 426; 526; 626) upon said selected volume; and

converting said imprinting fluid to solid imprint material (334; 434; 534; 634), with said selected volume being a quantity sufficient to fixedly attach said template to said template transfer substrate while maintaining a space between a mold (328; 428; 528; 628) and said template transfer substrate.

13. The method as recited in claim 12 wherein converting further includes urging said template (326; 426; 526; 626) upon said selected volume so that, upon converting said imprint material, said solid imprint material (334; 434; 534; 634) either surrounds said mold entirely or surrounds a portion of said mold.

14. The method as recited in claim 11 or 12 wherein converting further includes urging said template (326; 426; 526; 626) upon said selected volume so that, upon converting said imprint material, said solid imprint material either hermetically seals a sub-portion of said mold or encapsulates said mold hermetically sealing said mold from an ambient.
15. A method of removing a template from an imprint head in an imprint lithography system including:
loading (722) the template transfer substrate (444) onto a wafer chuck (21) in the imprint lithography system (10);
dispensing (724) a selected volume of imprinting fluid onto the surface of the template transfer substrate (444);
achieving a relative movement (726) between the imprint head (18) holding a template and the template transfer substrate (444) so that the template contacts the imprinting fluid;
converting (728) the imprinting fluid to solid imprint material; and
releasing the template from the imprint head (18).
